mdContact.rpOrgName: County of Napa Planning, Building, and Environmental Services Department.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This GIS layer contains the locations and attributes (e.g. approved gallons per year production volumes, approved visitation rates, etc) of wineries located within Napa County.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This layer contains the locations and attributes for wineries in Napa County and forms the core of the County's "winery database".
dataIdInfo.idCredit: County of Napa Planning, Building, and Environmental Services Department

idPoC.rpOrgName: County of Napa Planning, Building, and Environmental Services Department.

Consts.useLimit: This layer is open data. It is made available under the Public Domain Dedication and License version v1.0 whose full text can be found at:http://opendatacommons.org/licenses/pddl/1.0/

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

Consts.useLimit:
Wineries falling within city boundaries

GIS staff uses a combination of data from the US Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (TTB), California Alcoholic Beverage Control (ABC), and coordination with local agencies to map locations of wineries within city boundaries. These locations are considered approximate at best. Details (e.g. production, visitation, etc.) regarding wineries that fall within city jurisdiction are not included in the winery database. Please consult individual cities for information on these wineries.

Users of this data are hereby notified that the appropriate public primary information sources should be consulted for verification of the information. Although every reasonable effort has been made to assure the accuracy of this data, the County of Napa makes no warranty, representation or guaranty as to the content, sequence, accuracy, timeliness or completeness of any of the data provided herein and explicitly disclaims any representations and warranties, including, without limitation, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. The County of Napa assumes no liability for any errors, omissions, or inaccuracies in the information provided regardless of how caused and assumes no liability for any decisions made or actions taken or not taken by the user of the data in reliance upon any information or data furnished hereunder. Because the GIS data provided is not warranted to be up-to-date, the user should check with the County staff for updated information.

attr.attrdef: Total approved (or proposed for pending wineries) current size of winery building or buildings, measured in square feet. Covered work areas are included in this figure.
Status of the winery. APVD: Approved winery, not producing PEND: Winery pending approval PROD: Active winery UNKNWN: Status unknown, needs follow-up
Winery name.
Feature geometry.

The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) visitors per year, based on the winery's marketing plan. NOTE: in most cases this figure is considered in addition to regular visitation.

The approved (or proposed for pending wineries) maximum number of daily visitors. NOTE: This is not always an exact number, as some wineries in the past were approved based on an average number of daily visitors.

The approved (or proposed for pending wineries) maximum number of weekly visitors. NOTE: This is not always an exact number, as some wineries in the past were approved based on an average number of weekly visitors.

The approved (or proposed for pending wineries) tours and tastings arrangement: APPT: By appointment only NO: No tours, no tasting PUB: Open to the public, no appointment necessary PVT: Private TST APPT: Tasting by appointment only
Contains staff notes regarding the winery entry.

This field denotes if the winery was established through the Small Winery Use Permit Exemption process. Wineries established through the Small Winery Use Permit Exemption process have an "x" in this column. NOTE: subsequent use permit approvals/modifications may have altered certain aspects of the winery's original small winery exemption status.
Denotes whether or not the winery falls within city limits. Wineries with an "x" in this field fall within city limits.
The application number of the last known use permit for the winery.
The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) parking spaces at the winery.
Lists the corresponding Napa County Board of Supervisor District number that the winery falls within.

This field lists the amount of wine, expressed in GPY (gallons per year) that is subject to the 75% rule. Of the GPY listed in this field, 75% of it must be sourced from within Napa County. NOTE: for newer wineries, this number may match the figure in the "Prod_Curr" field. For older wineries, especially pre-WDO wineries who have expanded their production area, the two figures could be different.
Lists the name of the AVA (American Viticultural Area) that the winery falls within.

This field denotes whether or not the winery is subject to the 75% grape sourcing rule (see Winery Definition Ordinance for details). Winery entries with an "x" in this column are subject to the 75% rule.
The approval date of the most recent use permit in the MM/DD/YYYY format.
Indicates whether the winery includes a cave. Wineries (or winery proposals) with caves contain an 'x' in this column.
The estimated date that the winery was put into operation (usually the first crush), expressed in the MM/DD/YYYY format.
Total approved (or proposed for pending wineries) original size of winery building or buildings, measured in square feet. Covered work areas are included in this figure.
The originally approved (or proposed for pending wineries) production volume, measured in GPY (gallons per year).
Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) regular winery visitors plus marketing event visitors per year.
Denotes whether or not the winery falls within the Airport Industrial Area Specific Plan (AIASP). Wineries with an "x" in this field fall within the AIASP.
The total size of the cave, measured in square feet.
Unique Winery Identification Number. Originally, this field was used to join the winery_attributes table to the Winery_locations point layer.
The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) marketing events per year, based on the winery's marketing plan.

The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) visitors per year. Unless otherwise stated in the use permit approval, this figure is generated by taking the Visit_Week field and multiplying it by 52 weeks.
The currently approved (or proposed for pending wineries) production volume, measured in GPY (gallons per year). For new and proposed wineries this figure may be the same as Prod_Orig.

This field denotes if the winery was established prior to the date of effectiveness (Feb 22, 1990) of the Winery Definition Ordinance. Wineries are considered pre-WDO if this column contains an "x". NOTE: being designated pre-WDO in this case does not necessarily mean the winery still retains certain pre-WDO conditions. Subsequent use permits may have altered certain aspects of the winery's original approval.

The total number of approved (or proposed for pending wineries) employees at the winery. This is not always an exact figure. In some cases winery use permit applications ask for a range (10 or fewer, 11-24, etc.), and in some cases an exact number is provided. For ranges, the max value is listed. For exact figures, FT employees are expressed as provided and PT employees are expressed as 0.5 per employee (i.e. a winery with 4 FT and 3 PT employees would be 5.5 total)
The total size of the winery (or proposed winery), expressed in square feet. This is the total building size plus the total cave size, if applicable.

dataLineage.statement:
The GIS winery database in SDE was converted from the original winery database housed in an MS Access database.
To enable public sharing of the layer, a view was created joining the winery_locations feature class and winery_attributes table into a single entity.

descript.abstract: Winery Public contains the details of each winery's location and each wineryâ€™s approval based on its most recent (or pending) use permit approval. Please note that database figures listed for pending wineries are subject to change based on the use permit review and approval process.
